description.narrative: (USAID Central Africa Regional): FY 2017 resources will directly support biodiversity conservation in the 10.6 million hectare Maringa-Lopori-Wamba landscape. The program will mitigate threats to biodiversity by strengthening local conservation capacity, enforcing wildlife laws, combating wildlife poaching and trafficking, and expanding economic incentives for conservation. The program will also support the creation of a new nature reserve in the landscape..USAID will use Sustainable Landscapes funds to maintain and enhance the carbon stocks and sequestration potential through sustainable forest management and reforestation, and to support the implementation of the national Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation strategy and action plan. Biodiversity funds will also indirectly support the sustainable landscapes objective by slowing deforestation and forest degradation and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The benefitting country is the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title.narrative: Midterm evaluation : phase III USAID Central Africa regional program for the environment
Evaluation a mi-parcours de la phase iii du programme regional pour l'environnement en Afrique Centrale
